Contributor.Laboratory: Research Technologies Branch / Microarray Research Facility
Contributor.Organization: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases

Platform.Title: NIAID Mycobacterium tuberculosis microarray Mtbb
Platform.Description: Printing by NIAID / Microarray Research Facility Surface type: non-adsorptive, epoxy-coated glass Attachment: covalent Array description: The custom microarrays are manufactured by the Microarray Research Facility of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIH/NIAID). Microarrays are printed with an Omnigrid robotic arrayer by Genomic Solutions (http://www.genomicsolutions.com ) that is fitted with a printhead and 32 SMP3 print tips from Telechem (http://www.arrayit.com ). The M. tuberculosis microarray (Mtbb) probe set is based on 70mer oligonucleotides from Qiagen's Tuberculosis Genome Oligo Set Version 1.0 ( http://oligos.qiagen.com/arrays/omad.php ). Oligonucleotide probes are distributed into 384-well polypropylene plates (Genetix, 384 micro array) and dissolved in print buffer (150mM sodium phosphate, pH 8.5, 4% sodium sulfate, 0.0001% N-lauryl sarcosyl) to a normalized 25 micromolar concentration. The Mtbb microarray spot densities are 270 microns (center-to-center). The microarrays are printed on MWG Epoxy Slides (MWG Biotech Inc., # 1150-000000) or PowerMatrix Slides (Full Moon Biosystems, # PXP-M) and treated by a method that is an adaptation of the manufacturer's instructions to allow higher throughput processing.

Column.Name: ID
Column.Description: NIH mAdb well id plus replicate number

Column.Name: MADB_WELL_ID
Column.Description: NIH mAdb plate-well identifier for oligo sample

Column.Name: OLIGO_ID
Column.Description: Oligo identifier

Column.Name: CLONE_ID
Column.Description: First CLONE_ID: Sanger Institute H37RV_ORF_name (GenBank Accession Number AL123456); Second CLONE_ID: The Institute for Genomic Research (TIGR) CDC1551_ORF_name (GenBank Accession Number AE000516);

Column.Name: CLONE_ID
Column.Description: First CLONE_ID: Sanger Institute H37RV_ORF_name (GenBank Accession Number AL123456); Second CLONE_ID: The Institute for Genomic Research (TIGR) CDC1551_ORF_name (GenBank Accession Number AE000516);

Column.Name: GENE
Column.Description: Gene Name

Column.Name: DESCRIPTION
Column.Description: Gene Description

Column.Name: SEQUENCE
Column.Description: Sequence of oligonucleotide probe, provided by Operon

Sample.Title: MTb-relE1 - 6 hr - repeat 1 - mAdbID:77666

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Treatment type: compound Agent: Anhydrotetracycline Treatment dose: 50 ng/ml (in ethanol at final 1uL/mL) Treatment time: 6 hours Treatment temperature: 37 C
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Trizol MTb Extraction Extraction method: Trizol-QIAgen RNeasy Kit Other: Mycobacterium tuberculosis was rapidly harvested and cell pellet suspended in Trizol, subjected to 2-3 rounds of bead beating (0.1mm zirconia beads), phase separation performed with CHCl3 and RNA purified with the Quiagen RNeasy clean up kit using Qiagen on-column DNase to remove contaminating DNA.
Channel.Label: cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Cy5 Labeling Protocol Other: 4ug total RNA is converted to cDNA using Invitrogen random primers and superscript III at 48C in presence of 10-fold excess of Cy5-dCTP above unlabeled dCTP according to manufacturer's instructions.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Treatment type: compound Agent: Ethanol Treatment dose: 1 ul/ml Treatment time: 6 hours Treatment temperature: 37 C
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Trizol MTb Extraction Extraction method: Trizol-QIAgen RNeasy Kit Other: Mycobacterium tuberculosis was rapidly harvested and cell pellet suspended in Trizol, subjected to 2-3 rounds of bead beating (0.1mm zirconia beads), phase separation performed with CHCl3 and RNA purified with the Quiagen RNeasy clean up kit using Qiagen on-column DNase to remove contaminating DNA.
Channel.Label: cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Cy3 Labeling Protocol Other: 4ug total RNA is converted to cDNA using Invitrogen random primers and superscript III at 48C in presence of 10-fold excess of Cy3-dCTP above unlabeled dCTP according to manufacturer's instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization Protocol Other: For pre-hybrization, apply 40 ul of pre-hybridization buffer (5X SSC, 0.1% SDS, 1% BSA) to the array and incubate at 42°C for at least 30 minutes and up to an hour. Wash off the pre-hybridization solution by rapidly plunging the slide in distilled water for 2 minutes, then transfer slide to 100% isopropanol for 2 minutes. Allow slide to air dry completely prior to use. (Can spin dry if in a rush.) (NOTE: Do not exceed 1 hour after pre-hybridization/drying before setting up hybridization.) For hybridization, combine Cy3 and Cy5 labeled targets together (~11 ul recovered for each). Add 1 µl herring sperm DNA (8-10 ug/ul) and 0.2 ul tNRA (8-10 ug/ul). Denature target at 100°C for 1 minute, then snap cool on ice. (Final volume should be about 12 ul.) Make fresh 2X Formamide hybridization buffer (50% formamide, 10X SSC, 0.2% SDS) and warm to 42°C just before adding to samples. Add 12 ul of 2X F-hyb buffer to samples. Load 25 ul sample onto microarray. Add 20 ul of 3X SSC to wells in hyb chamber to maintain humidity. Incubate overnight (12-16 hours) at 42°C in water bath or hybridization oven. After hybridization of slides, wash slides for 2 minute in 2X SSC with 0.1% SDS (on rocking platform), for 2 minute in 1X SSC (with rocking), for 2 minutes in 0.2X SSC (on rocking platform), for 1 minute in 0.05X SSC, and spin for 3 minutes at 650 rpm to dry.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Creator: GenePix Pro 4.0.1.22 Scanner: GenePix 4000B [83871] ScanPower: 100;; 100 LaserPower: 2.88;; 3.7 Temperature: 30.97
Sample.Data-Processing: mAdb Data Processing Protocol (v. 2) Calculation Method: After background correction, ratios were median centered based on signals greater than 100 in both channels and linear transformed to obtain the log and linear values given in the data table.

Channel.Label: cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Cy5 Labeling Protocol Other: 4ug total RNA is converted to cDNA using Invitrogen random primers and superscript III at 48C in presence of 10-fold excess of Cy5-dCTP above unlabeled dCTP according to manufacturer's instructions.

Channel.Label: cy3

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization Protocol Other: For pre-hybrization, apply 40 ul of pre-hybridization buffer (5X SSC, 0.1% SDS, 1% BSA) to the array and incubate at 42°C for at least 30 minutes and up to an hour. Wash off the pre-hybridization solution by rapidly plunging the slide in distilled water for 2 minutes, then transfer slide to 100% isopropanol for 2 minutes. Allow slide to air dry completely prior to use. (Can spin dry if in a rush.) (NOTE: Do not exceed 1 hour after pre-hybridization/drying before setting up hybridization.) For hybridization, combine Cy3 and Cy5 labeled targets together (~11 ul recovered for each). Add 1 µl herring sperm DNA (8-10 ug/ul) and 0.2 ul tNRA (8-10 ug/ul). Denature target at 100°C for 1 minute, then snap cool on ice. (Final volume should be about 12 ul.) Make fresh 2X Formamide hybridization buffer (50% formamide, 10X SSC, 0.2% SDS) and warm to 42°C just before adding to samples. Add 12 ul of 2X F-hyb buffer to samples. Load 25 ul sample onto microarray. Add 20 ul of 3X SSC to wells in hyb chamber to maintain humidity. Incubate overnight (12-16 hours) at 42°C in water bath or hybridization oven. After hybridization of slides, wash slides for 2 minute in 2X SSC with 0.1% SDS (on rocking platform), for 2 minute in 1X SSC (with rocking), for 2 minutes in 0.2X SSC (on rocking platform), for 1 minute in 0.05X SSC, and spin for 3 minutes at 650 rpm to dry.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Treatment type: compound Agent: Anhydrotetracycline Treatment dose: 50 ng/ml (in ethanol at final 1uL/mL) Treatment time: 24 hours Treatment temperature: 37 C
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Trizol MTb Extraction Extraction method: Trizol-QIAgen RNeasy Kit Other: Mycobacterium tuberculosis was rapidly harvested and cell pellet suspended in Trizol, subjected to 2-3 rounds of bead beating (0.1mm zirconia beads), phase separation performed with CHCl3 and RNA purified with the Quiagen RNeasy clean up kit using Qiagen on-column DNase to remove contaminating DNA.
Channel.Label: cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Cy5 Labeling Protocol Other: 4ug total RNA is converted to cDNA using Invitrogen random primers and superscript III at 48C in presence of 10-fold excess of Cy5-dCTP above unlabeled dCTP according to manufacturer's instructions.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Treatment type: compound Agent: Ethanol Treatment dose: 1 ul/ml Treatment time: 24 hours Treatment temperature: 37 C
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Trizol MTb Extraction Extraction method: Trizol-QIAgen RNeasy Kit Other: Mycobacterium tuberculosis was rapidly harvested and cell pellet suspended in Trizol, subjected to 2-3 rounds of bead beating (0.1mm zirconia beads), phase separation performed with CHCl3 and RNA purified with the Quiagen RNeasy clean up kit using Qiagen on-column DNase to remove contaminating DNA.
Channel.Label: cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Cy3 Labeling Protocol Other: 4ug total RNA is converted to cDNA using Invitrogen random primers and superscript III at 48C in presence of 10-fold excess of Cy3-dCTP above unlabeled dCTP according to manufacturer's instructions.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Hybridization Protocol Other: For pre-hybrization, apply 40 ul of pre-hybridization buffer (5X SSC, 0.1% SDS, 1% BSA) to the array and incubate at 42°C for at least 30 minutes and up to an hour. Wash off the pre-hybridization solution by rapidly plunging the slide in distilled water for 2 minutes, then transfer slide to 100% isopropanol for 2 minutes. Allow slide to air dry completely prior to use. (Can spin dry if in a rush.) (NOTE: Do not exceed 1 hour after pre-hybridization/drying before setting up hybridization.) For hybridization, combine Cy3 and Cy5 labeled targets together (~11 ul recovered for each). Add 1 µl herring sperm DNA (8-10 ug/ul) and 0.2 ul tNRA (8-10 ug/ul). Denature target at 100°C for 1 minute, then snap cool on ice. (Final volume should be about 12 ul.) Make fresh 2X Formamide hybridization buffer (50% formamide, 10X SSC, 0.2% SDS) and warm to 42°C just before adding to samples. Add 12 ul of 2X F-hyb buffer to samples. Load 25 ul sample onto microarray. Add 20 ul of 3X SSC to wells in hyb chamber to maintain humidity. Incubate overnight (12-16 hours) at 42°C in water bath or hybridization oven. After hybridization of slides, wash slides for 2 minute in 2X SSC with 0.1% SDS (on rocking platform), for 2 minute in 1X SSC (with rocking), for 2 minutes in 0.2X SSC (on rocking platform), for 1 minute in 0.05X SSC, and spin for 3 minutes at 650 rpm to dry.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Creator: GenePix Pro 4.0.1.17 Scanner: GenePix 4000B [83871] ScanPower: 100;; 100 LaserPower: 2.52;; 3.77 Temperature: 30.66
Sample.Data-Processing: mAdb Data Processing Protocol (v. 2) Calculation Method: After background correction, ratios were median centered based on signals greater than 100 in both channels and linear transformed to obtain the log and linear values given in the data table.

Series.Title: Transcriptional analysis of RelE family toxin overexpression in Mycobacterium tuberculosis
Series.Summary: To understand the mechanism of action of the RelE family of toxins on metabolism of Mycobacterium tuberculosis. To this effect, toxin expression was induced under control of a tetracycline regulatable promoter and transcriptional profiles compared during overexpression of the three RelE toxin family members. Profiles were also compared to previously published profiles of drugs of known mechanism of action against this organism.
Series.Overall-Design: For the design, RNA isolated from cells where toxin expression was induced with anhydrotetracycline was converted to Cy5-labeled cDNA whereas RNA derived from cells in which toxin expression was not induced (treated with ethanol solvent only) was converted to Cy3-labeled cDNA. Time points were taken for each overexpression condition. Treatments were performed indepedently a minimum of two times to give independent biological replicates.
